lead_paragraph: The recent influx of refugees in the Mediterranean has raised questions about rescue obligations and willingness of nations to accept human cargo.

headline.print_headline: Captains, Duty Bound to Rescue at Sea, Seek Clearer Policies Ashore
headline.main: Ship’s Captains Call for Uniform Policies on Migrants at Sea

snippet: The recent influx of refugees in the Mediterranean has raised questions about rescue obligations and willingness of nations to accept human cargo.
abstract: Captains of merchant and navy ships in Mediterranean are bound by international customs and laws to rescue those in distress, but they are having trouble finding countries that will accept growing number of refugees rescued during risky ventures across sea to Europe; European Union acknowledges a disunity over how policies concerning human rights and refugee law relate to the law of the sea.
